instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.A1502: What is A1502? A1502 is a model number for a 13 inch size MacBook Pro Retina from years Mid 2014, Late 2013, Early 2015 with EMC 2875, that may contain one of these boards depending on the year & configuration: 820-3476, 820-3536, 820-4924..
definitions.820-3536: What is 820-3536? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.U1950: What is U1950? This chip often becomes corroded on pin 8 on the PP3V42_G3H pin causing PM_SLP_S4_L to go missing.
definitions.ALL_SYS_PWRGD: What is ALL_SYS_PWRGD? ALL_SYS_PWRGD is present when PP1V8_S3, PP5V_S3, PP1V2_S3, PP1V05_S0, PP5V_S0, PP3V3_S0, & PP1V5_S0 are present and working. If any of these rails is not working, ALL_SYS_PWRGD will be pulled down and the machine will not turn on. .
definitions.PP5V_S0: What is PP5V_S0? PP5V_S0 is a 5v power rail present when the system is in an S0 working state..
definitions.3V3_S5: What is 3V3_S5? 3V3_S5 and PP3V3_S5 are interchangeable, see definition for PP3V3_S5. .
definitions.PP3V3_S5: What is PP3V3_S5? PP3V3_S5 is a 3.3v power rail when the system is in an S5 soft off power state.
definitions.PP5V_S5: What is PP5V_S5? This is a 5v power rail that is present when the machine is in an S5 soft off state..
definitions.PP3V3_SUS: What is PP3V3_SUS? The "PP3V3_SUS" rail on a MacBook logic board is a power rail that provides a 3.3-volt supply to the suspend-to-RAM (S3 state) components. .
definitions.PP5V_S4: What is PP5V_S4? PP5V_S4 is a 5v power rail present when the machine is in an S4 suspend to disk state..
definitions.5V_S0: What is 5V_S0? 5V_S5 is an abbreviation for “PP5V_S0”.

threads.title: <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1502</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>  <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3536</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A Green Light no power
threads.message:
Hi Guys.

i Have this <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1502</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> green light no power issue. <SIGNAL>ALL_SYS_PWRGD</SIGNAL> is not there on <CHIP>U1950</CHIP> and <SIGNAL>PP5V_S0</SIGNAL> is 0.17v... any suggestions please

Thanks  :D

threads.title: <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1502</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>  <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3536</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A Green Light no power
threads.message:
Welcome to the forum.

Do you get <SIGNAL>3V3_S5</SIGNAL>/SUS?
Please post basic information, if you want to get help.
Any history fault available?

threads.title: <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1502</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>  <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3536</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A Green Light no power
threads.message:
Hi 2informaticos.

NO liquid damage just stopped on it's own.  

i have <SIGNAL>PP3V3_S5</SIGNAL> 3.3v and also <SIGNAL>PP3V3_SUS</SIGNAL> 3.3v present and also <SIGNAL>PP5V_S5</SIGNAL> and <SIGNAL>PP5V_S4</SIGNAL>.

<SIGNAL>PP5V_S0</SIGNAL> is not present, but after speding some more time on it i noticed that <RESISTOR>R5530</RESISTOR> has a bit of corrosion and i need to look into it. I'll update on the status and if needed some help.

Thank you very much

threads.title: <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1502</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>  <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3536</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A Green Light no power
threads.message:
<RESISTOR>R5530</RESISTOR> is current sensor for <SIGNAL>5V_S0</SIGNAL> power rail.
Check traces to <CHIP>U5530</CHIP>.
If resistor is good, board should start in SMC bypass, if there is a problem with that sensor.
